header.title: The Scroll of Set - July 1995
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Philosophy, Black Magic

central_thesis: The Temple of Set promotes a system of Black Magic rooted in individual self-deification and conscious evolution (Xeper), distinguishing itself from previous forms of Satanism while acknowledging its historical and archetypal significance. Setian practice involves structured rituals and the manipulation of both subjective and objective realities to achieve self-transformation and manifest the individual's will.

structure_content.summary: A ceremonial blessing calling upon the forces of Darkness for Setians to achieve understanding, fulfill Set's purpose, and manifest their will for the Eternal Set, emphasizing chaos, order, understanding, being, creation, death, birth, and re-creation as aspects of Setian evolution.

structure_content.chapter_title: [2] Why God Never Received Tenure at any University
structure_content.summary: A satirical piece presenting a humorous list of reasons why the Judæo-Christian God would not qualify for academic tenure, highlighting perceived inconsistencies and lack of scientific rigor from a secular, academic perspective.

An analysis of a 'Wordfinder' puzzle, revealing hidden patterns that form 'Set', 'temple', and 'priesthood', interpreting this as a symbolic representation of the foundational intertwining of the Priesthood within the Temple of Set.
A listing of Setian individuals who have been formally Recognized as Adept II°, marking their progression within the Temple's initiatory hierarchy.
An announcement for a publication featuring Setian-related topics like 'Remanifestation' and 'The Immortality of the Psyche', inviting contributions and exchanges.

Argues that maintaining the 'Satanist' label is a practical necessity for Setians within a Judæo/Christian society, serving to define independence from J/C thought, preserve roots, and attract the 'Elect' who resonate with the 'Satan' archetype.

Explores Set's Mandate as a command to create specific properties of consciousness for immortality, emphasizing active self-centered transformation and the emulation of Set as the 'giver of the Gift' rather than passive adherence.

structure_content.chapter_title: [8] Friendship and Respect within the Temple of Set
structure_content.summary: Discusses the importance of fostering respect and privacy among Setian initiates, acknowledging individual differences as fertile ground for Xeper and Remanifestation, and highlighting the friction between friendship and the initiatory process.

Positions Setian philosophy as a process-oriented path towards solving the 'problem' of the Gift, where individuals identify with and emulate Set. It addresses the historical role of Satanism as a 'baggage' from an earlier phase, distinct from the current 'real work' of Setian evolution.

Defines Setian rituals as deliberate thought-and-action processes aimed at understanding and manipulating subjects, leading to personal transformation and the 'ascendance of divinity within self', differentiating them from passive religious practices.

Analyzes the 'Vampire: The Masquerade' role-playing game within an occult context, noting its themes of survival and humanity against the 'Beast' as relevant to Setian concepts and its appeal to creative individuals, contrasting it with traditional Satanic imagery.

structure_content.chapter_title: [12] Leys: Tools of the Black Magician
structure_content.summary: Explains ley lines as geomagnetic patterns that Black Magicians can utilize, through natural or artificial means, to enhance ritual work and manipulate the environment for the purpose of Xeper, drawing on historical and contemporary occult practices.

structure_content.chapter_title: [13] Satanism: To Be or Not To Be?
structure_content.summary: Argues for de-emphasizing 'Satanism' in public discourse to navigate profane society's fear, while affirming its internal value within the Temple of Set as a crucial historical and philosophical foundation that provided the 'Black Flame' and 'nobility of individuality' before the advent of Xeper.

structure_content.chapter_title: [14] Is the Setian the P.C. Satanist?
structure_content.summary: Questions the influence of 'political correctness' on Setian views of Satanism, asserting the practical utility of LaVeyan Satanism as an entry point for new Initiates and stressing the need to differentiate Setian philosophy from Judæo/Christian interpretations of 'evil'.

Connects Setian ideals of individual liberty and separation from the collective to the principles of the Declaration of Independence, suggesting that 'inalienable rights' are adjunct to the Black Flame and the Prince of Darkness, emphasizing the moral and ethical foundations of Western civilization.

structure_content.chapter_title: [16] A Spell for Crossing the Desert in the Year of the Heb Sed
structure_content.summary: Explores the divine formula Xepera Xeper Xeperu as an operative spell for survival across the 'unknown,' focused on strengthening the mind/soul for immortality through active self-creation and conscious decisions, rather than passive protection of the body.

structure_content.chapter_title: [17] On Amon, Ra, Ptah, and Set
structure_content.summary: Analyzes the Egyptian divine aspects of Amon (hidden name/subjective), Ra (image/objective), and Ptah (definition/communicable), and introduces Set as the 'isolator' who separates the seeker through divine experience, enabling self-creation and the passing on of knowledge.

Discusses the Temple of Set's historical relationship with Satanism, portraying 'Lucifer/Satan' as a magnificent archetype of independent will and existence that inspired the 'Black Flame'. It advocates for evolving this vision beyond Judæo-Christian limitations while acknowledging profane society's inability to comprehend Setian perspectives.

key_concepts.definition: A philosophy and magical system centered on the individual's self-deification and conscious evolution (Xeper), distinct from passive belief systems.
The core Setian principle meaning 'to Come Into Being' or 'I have Come Into Being.' It is an active, willed process of self-creation, transformation, and growth beyond previous patterns.
The intrinsic spark of individuality and potential for self-transformation within each Setian, kindled by the Eternal Set.
A command or authority from Set to create specific properties of consciousness that ensure immortality, requiring active emulation of Set and the exercise of authority.

A thought-and-action-based process used for understanding, manipulating subjects, and achieving self-transformation, aimed at the 'ascendance of divinity within self'. It integrates quiet contemplation with active measures.
Patterns of invisible angles or lines, representing geomagnetic fields, that Black Magicians can utilize to enhance ritual work and manipulate their environment for the purpose of Xeper.

Historically, a crucial precursor to Setianism, particularly the 'Satan' archetype, which served as a bridge for attracting individuals to self-centered thinking. While foundational, it is now considered a limited, transitional phase distinct from the evolved Setian philosophy.
The god of the name, the hidden. Represents the subjective approach to the subjective universe and the direct, internal experience of the divine, accessible only to the individual.
The god of the image, the seen. Represents the objective manifestation of the subjective universe and unnatural concepts made visible in the natural world.
The god of definition, the communicable concept. Represents the creation of tools or systems that transform the user, allowing others to partake in the divine experience indirectly.

The fourth aspect of the divine, realized as a willed action that separates the seeker from the cosmos. It is the culmination of experiencing Amon, Ra, and Ptah, leading to the knowledge of 'Coming Into Being'.
A divine formula for 'Coming Into Being' and 'self-creation,' serving as an operative spell for the perpetuation and furtherance of the subjective universe, used for strengthening the mind/soul.

practical_system.description: The Temple of Set presents a practical system of Black Magic focused on the individual's conscious evolution ('Xeper') and self-deification. This system moves beyond passive belief or 'higher self' pursuits, emphasizing active engagement with both the subjective universe (internal states, understanding) and the objective world (external manifestations, influence). The aim is to create properties of consciousness that enable immortality and to 'Become Set' in one's rituals, making one's will manifest.
tools: The Black Flame (inherent potential within the individual).
Individual Will (to influence processes and create change).
Ritual chambers (designed and prepared with specific lighting, music, and props).
Ley lines and geomagnetic fields (natural or artificially induced through stones, metals, hammering, or heating).
Definitions, organizations, and creations that transform the user (tools of Ptah).
Setian literature and teachings (e.g., 'Book of Coming Forth by Night').
Engagement with difficult experiences ('disturbing the cosmos').
The 'Satan' archetype (as a historical and psychological bridge to self-centered thinking and rebellion).
rituals: Thought-and-action-based rituals to understand, manipulate, and self-transform.
Creation of semi-constant psychic states through initiation.
Creating 'gates' into the objective universe to communicate states of being by example.
Utilization of the Xepera Xeper Xeperu formula for self-creation, survival, and perpetuation of the subjective universe.
Manipulation of geomagnetic fields (ley lines) to enhance ritual work and influence the environment.
Personal reflection and questioning to refine the self and push the envelopes of initiatory degrees.

relevant_quotes.text: Honor to the Eternal Set, who hath kindled the Black Flame in me...
Set's Mandate is to create certain properties of consciousness such that consciousness itself does not fade from this planet.
Magic is the most difficult thing to do well. This is understandable since magic is alien to the world in which we move about. Magic is the highest expression of the world-disturber, Set.
The Æonic formula Xepera Xeper Xeperu posits a model where existing forms are destroyed by the Setian as a necessary part of transformation.
Initiation does not teach you to know or do anything in particular. It is rather a process of awakening certain latent sensitivities within rare individuals.
Set appears at the last of the process of changing yourself from a human into a divine being.
The first is the eternal point of reference, that realm where such Forms as Justice and Beauty exist. You partake of that realm since you can conceive of these concepts.
The greatest experience of Ptah is when something you’ve created leads to the self-creation of another.
“Satan” and “Satanism” will continue to be subjective terms, which anyone may use in an almost limitless kaleidoscope of meanings.

critical_analysis.relevance: This collection of articles from 'The Scroll of Set' in July 1995 provides a crucial snapshot of the Temple of Set's internal philosophical development and external positioning during a significant period. It illuminates the ongoing process of defining Setianism as distinct from its historical roots in LaVeyan Satanism, particularly concerning the concept of Xeper and the practical application of Black Magic. The debate on the 'Satanist' label is central, reflecting the organization's self-perception and strategic approach to public and internal identity. It is highly relevant for understanding the evolution of modern Left-Hand Path movements and the specific intellectual currents within the Temple of Set.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of Initiates of the Temple of Set, particularly those at the I° and II° degrees, who are engaged in their personal initiatory work and seeking deeper understanding of Setian philosophy and magical practice. It also caters to advanced practitioners and leaders seeking to clarify and communicate the core tenets of Setianism. Academics and researchers in Western Esotericism and occult studies would find it valuable for its detailed insights into the operational and philosophical mechanics of a modern magical order.
